choices.A: It always authorizes the traffic without requiring authentication.
choices.D: It authenticates the traffic using the authentication scheme SCHEME1.
choices.C: It authenticates the traffic using the authentication scheme SCHEME2.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The exhibit shows a FortiGate configuration.
How does FortiGate handle web proxy traffic coming from the IP address 10.2.1.200, that requires authorization?

discussion.content:
- FGT Security 7.2 p310
 - The application control profile scans for matches in this order:
 ○ Application and filter overrides: If you have configured any applications overrides or filter overrides, the application control profile considers those first. It looks for a matching override starting at the top of the list, like firewall policies.
 ○ Categories: Finally, the application control profiles applies the action that you've configured for applications in your selected categories.

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D.

questions.question_text: Which statement about the IP authentication header (AH) used by IPsec is true?

choices.A: AH does not support perfect forward secrecy.
choices.B: AH provides strong data integrity but weak encryption.
choices.C: AH provides data integrity but no encryption.
choices.D: AH does not provide any data integrity or encryption.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

questions.question_text: Which two statements about antivirus scanning mode are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
otherwise answers are not correct in general

choices.A: In proxy-based inspection mode, antivirus buffers the whole file for scanning, before sending it to the client.
choices.C: In proxy-based inspection mode, files bigger than the buffer size are scanned.
choices.B: In full scan flow-based inspection mode, FortiGate buffers the file, but also simultaneously transmits it to the client.
choices.D: In quick scan mode, you can configure antivirus profiles to use any of the available antivirus signature databases.

questions.question_text: How do you format the FortiGate flash disk?

choices.A: Execute the CLI command execute formatlogdisk.
choices.B: Select the format boot device option from the BIOS menu.

discussion.content: B is correct for Flash Memory according to Infrastructure_manual-6.2, p.403

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Never heard of "Flash Disk", if it refers to Flash Memory the answer is B.

Fortigate Infrastructure P. 403
A is correct for log flash disk and B is correct for boot flash disk, this cuestion is wrong
